intro: Swainsona campylantha, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in dense, globular inflorescences. The plant is a shrub or small tree, typically growing up to 3 meters in height. Its leaves are pinnate, with multiple leaflets arranged along a central axis. Swainsona campylantha is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient component of native Australian flora.
